requirements.title: Launch detection
requirements.descr: The system shall be able to detect launches if the acceleration is larger than \SI{6}{\meter \per \second^2}.

requirements.title: Velocity estimation
requirements.descr: The system shall be able to estimate the current velocity. TODO precision.

requirements.title: Velocity control
requirements.descr: The system shall be able to control the velocity TODO performance.

requirements.title: Attitude estimation
requirements.descr: The system shall be able to estimate the current attitude.

requirements.title: Attitude control
requirements.descr: The system shall be able to control the attitude depending on the current flight situation.

requirements.title: Position estimation
requirements.descr: The system shall be able to estimate the current position.

requirements.title: Position control
requirements.descr: The system shall be able to fly to given positions.

requirements.title: Altitude estimation
requirements.descr: The system shall be able to estimate the current altitude over ground.

requirements.title: Altitude control
requirements.descr: The system shall be able to control the current altitude over ground.

requirements.title: Mission Execution
requirements.descr: A mission, consisting of a list of waypoints with altitude and optional heading and a target point with the same information shall be able to be flown by the plane.

requirements.title: Energy Storage
requirements.descr: The airplane has sufficient energy to complete the required distance of 100km.

requirements.title: Debug Channel
requirements.descr: The airplane can transmit data while loitering at the launch site.

requirements.title: Debug Display
requirements.descr: Debug information transmitted by the plane can be displayed to the user.

requirements.title: Partitioning
requirements.descr: The system is partitioned into the following components: \begin{itemize} \item Mechanical: \begin{itemize} \item Airframe (AF) \item Control Surfaces Actuators (CS) \item Electric Powertrain (PW) \end{itemize} \item Electronical: \begin{itemize} \item Flightcontroller (FC) \item Flightcomputer (FCP) \item Power Distribution Board (PDB) \item Navigation Board (NAV) \item RC-Receiver (RX) \item RC-Transmitter (TX) \end{itemize} \item Software: \begin{itemize} \item Flightcontroller-Software (FCS) \item Flightcomputer-Software (FCPS) \item Power Distribution Board Software (PDBS) \item Navigation Board Software (NAVS) \end{itemize} \end{itemize} An overview of the data flow between the partitions is given in Figure\ref{fig:sys-hl:partition}. \begin{figure}[H] \centering \includegraphics[width=.7\textwidth]{system.eps} \caption{System Partitioning and Data Flow } \label{fig:sys-hl:partition } \end{figure}
requirements.reason: This partitioning allows to implement the components individually from each other and thus allows to limit the complexity of the mission-critical components.

requirements.title: Frequency of FCPS control loop
requirements.descr: The FCPS runs all control loops with at least $\SI{10}{\hertz}$.
requirements.reason: This guarantees sufficient time for all calculations but also guarantees a sufficient controller performance as $\SI{100}{\milli\second}$ is much smaller than all time-constants of the orientation-controlled system.

requirements.title: Frequency of FCS control loop
requirements.descr: The FCS runs all control loops with at least $\SI{50}{\hertz}$.
requirements.reason: The motor and servo commands can only be sent at this frequency, thus a faster control loop would not bring any advantages.

requirements.title: Manual overrid
requirements.descr: The system shall be able to be controlled manually while closer than 200m to the pilot.
requirements.reason: This allows handling errors during launch without risk of crashing.
